sn12.41:2.1: “Fear” (bhaya) and “enmity” (vera) arise when living in a manner hostile or harmful to others. Refraining from harm is a gift of freedom from fear for countless creatures as well as oneself (AN 8.39:3.6). Kauṭilya says that spies can exploit such fears and enmities to create dissension (Arthaśāstra 9.6.69).
sn12.41:12.1: A ñāya is a “system”, method, or way of practice that proceeds in line with cause and effect.
